channel.title: DeviceSpecifications
channel.description: Mobile device specifications, comparisons, news, user reviews and ratings

item.title: The rugged Doogee S86 Pro goes official with an infrared thermometer
item.description: Doogee has unveiled the Doogee S86 Pro - this is the Doogee S86 with more RAM - 8GB instead of 6GB, and an infrared thermometer replacing the macro camera on the back panel. All the rest is the same, including the 6.09-inch IPS display with an HD+ resolution (720 x 1560), Corning Gorilla Glass, and glove mode support. The old and reliable Helio P60 chipset ticks under the hood. There are 128 GB...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: POCO India teases the POCO F3 GT, will be unveiled in Q3 of 2021
item.description: POCO India has teased the POCO F3 GT. This smartphone is expected to be launched in the third quarter of this year and will be an international version of the Redmi K40 Gaming Edition, which was announced a month ago. Assuming, this turns out to be right, the POCO F3 GT should be based on a Dimensity 1200 chipset with APU 3.0 and a three-layered cooling system with VC. There will be 6GB/8GB/12GB...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Realme X7 Max 5G - the Realme GT Neo for the global market
item.description: The Realme GT Neo is a China-bound model and today Realme announced its global version - the Realme X7 Max 5G. Both smartphones are based on a MediaTek Dimensity 1200 chipset with 8GB/12GB of LPDDR4X RAM and 128GB/256GB of UFS 3.1 storage. The latter cannot be expanded. The devices run on Android 11 with realme UI 2.0 on top. They are built around a 6.43-inch Super AMOLED display with an FHD+...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: UMIDIGI A11 is launched with a 6.53" HD+ IPS display, Helio G25 chipset, infrared thermometer
item.description: The UMIDGI A11 has been launched priced at USD 120 for the 3GB+64GB version and USD 14 for the 4GB+128GB version. This smartphone has a 6.53-inch in-cell IPS display with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixels and a waterdrop notch for the 8MP front-facing camera with an f/2.2 aperture and a 5-element lens. A side-mounted fingerprint sensor is embedded in the power button on the right frame of the...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Samsung Display and LG Display have begun producing OLED panels for Apple's iPhone 13 series
item.description: South Korean news outlet The Elec reports that Samsung Display and LG Display have begun producing OLED panels for the upcoming iPhone 13 series. Compared to last year, this is a month faster. Last year Apple experienced problems procuring components for its devices resulting in delaying the launch of the iPhone 12 series. Hence, the earlier start of display production for this year's models is...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Ulefone unveils the Armor 11T 5G with an infrared thermal camera
item.description: After unveiling the Armor 11 5G in February, Ulefone is now unveiling a version of this model that boasts an infrared thermal camera. The new smartphone is called Ulefone Armor 11T 5G. It is identical to the previous model with the only difference being the rear camera department. The Armor 11T has a 48MP main shooter with an f/1.79 aperture, 79-degree FoV. It is adjoined by a 2MP depth-sensing...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Oppo Reno6, Reno6 Pro, and Reno6 Pro+ are announced in China - specs and prices
item.description: Oppo has unveiled the Reno6 series today in China. Let's begin with the top model - the Oppo Reno6 Pro+ which is based on a Snapdragon 870 chipset and is powered by a 4500 mAh battery with 65W fast charging support. The smartphone is built around a 3D curved 6.55-inch AMOLED display with an FHD+ resolution and 90Hz refresh rate, 1100 nits of peak brightness and 100% DCI-P3 color space coverage...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: nubia Red Magic 6R is unveiled with a 144Hz 6.67" AMOLED display, four rear cameras, SD888 chipset
item.description: The nubia Red Magic 6R has been unveiled in China as a high-end smartphone that can easily turn into a gaming device when needed to. This model arrives with a 6.67-inch AMOLED display with an FHD+ resolution, 10-bit color, 144Hz refresh rate, and 360Hz touch sampling rate. Touch sensors on the frame serve as shoulder triggers and the Snapdragon 888 chipset under the hood makes sure any game will...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Realme Narzo 30 5G goes official in Europe to compete with the POCO M3 Pro
item.description: As usual, Realme releases a smartphone that's meant to compete directly with one of Xiaomi's models. This time it is about the Realme Narzo 30 5G vs the POCO M3 Pro in Europe. Both smartphones have 6.5-inch FHD+ IPS displays with 90Hz refresh rate. Realme did not specify the protective glass on the NArzo 30 5G. On the POCO M3 Pro, this is a Corning Gorillas Glass 3. Further, both smartphones are...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Xiaomi Redmi Note 10 Pro for China with Dimensity 1100 goes official - specifications and prices
item.description: Yet another smartphone from the Redmi Note 10 series has been announced. This time, it is the Xiaomi Redmi Note 10 Pro for China, which is quite different from the Xiaomi Redmi Note 10 Pro for India and the Xiaomi Redmi Note 10 Pro Global. The China model is based on a Dimensity 1100 chipset paired to 6GB or 8GB of LPDDRX RAM and 128GB or 256GB of UFS 3.1 storage. The SoC is cooled by a VC liquid...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: BOE's B12 Gen 6 OLED production line will enter operation in October
item.description: BOE's B12 Gen 6 (1500 x 1850 mm) OLED production line at Chongqing will enter operation in October, according to South Korean news outlet The Elec. So far, BOE has a B11 line at Mianyang and a B7 line at Chengdu, both in the Sichuan Province. Each of those makes 48,000 substrates per month. During the first phase, the B12 Gen 6 line will make 16,000 substrates. After phase two in March 2022 and...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: The Samsung Galaxy Tab S7 FE 5G goes official in Europe with a Snapdragon 750G chipset, 12.4" IPS display
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy Tab S7 FE 5G has been quietly launched in Europe and can already be found on Samsung Germany's website priced at EUR 649. This tablet is built around a 12.4-inch IPS display with a resolution of 2560 x 1600 pixels. The aluminum body is available in black and silver colors. The device runs on Android 11 with ONE Ui 3.1 on top and is based on a Qualcomm Snapdragon 750G chipset...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: iQOO Neo5 Lite is unveiled sporting a Snapdragon 870 chipset and a 144Hz, 6.57" IPS display
item.description: iQOO Neo5 Lite has been unveiled today sporting a Snapdragon 870 chipset. The smartphone is equipped with a 6.57-inch IPS display with FHD+ resolution and 144Hz refresh rate. A punch hole in the top right corner of the screen houses the 16MP selfie snapper, while on the back of the handset vivo has provided a 48MP main shooter, an 8MP ultra-wide camera, and a 2MP macro unit. The iQOO Neo5 Lite is...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: The Doogee S97 Pro is the world's first smartphone with a laser rangefinder, Doogee announces a giveaway
item.description: The Doogee S97 Pro is the world's first smartphone with an integrated laser rangefinder. This feature has a number of applications in real life. For starters, it is very useful in sports that require precision distance measurement such as golf, archery, hunting, etc. Laser rangefinders are used for forest inventories, during hunting, for military use, for construction use, or at home when doing...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Our in-depth POCO M3 Pro 5G review is ready
item.description: Our POCO M3 Pro 5G full review is now ready. As usual, we provide you with detailed information about every aspect of the smartphone, including various measurements, tests, lots of photos, graphs, comparison tables, and screenshots. If you want to acquaint yourself with this smartphone in detail, here are the separate pages from our in-depth review: POCO M3 Pro 5G specifications and unboxing POCO...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: POCO M3 Pro - specifications, prices, coupon codes for discounts
item.description: Yesterday, POCO unveiled the POCO M3 Pro - a budget smartphone with 5G connectivity and great design. The device features a 6.5-inch IPS display with an FHD+ resolution. It supports up to 90Hz refresh rate and the Dynamic Switch technology allows the device to automatically adjust the refresh rate to 30Hz, 50Hz, 60Hz, and 90Hz depending on the app/content. The screen is protected by a Corning...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: nubia Z30 Pro is unveiled with a 6.67" 144Hz OLED display, Snapdragon 888, three 64MP cameras
item.description: The nubia Z30 Pro has just been announced featuring a Snapdragon 888 chipset paired to 8GB/12GB/16GB of RAM and 256/512GB of storage. The front is adorned with a 6.67-inch OLED display with an FHD+ resolution and 144Hz refresh rate. It supports 10-bit color and HDR10+. A 4600 mAh battery keeps the lights on and supports 120W fast charging. The camera department includes a 64MP Sony IMX686 main...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Sharp Aquos R6 with a Pro IGZO OLED display and 240Hz refresh rate goes official in Japan
item.description: Sharp has announced a premium smartphone for the Japanese market that will go on sale in mid-June 2021. The Sharp Aquos R6 is adorned with a 6.6" Pro IGZO OLED display supporting refresh rates from 1Hz to 240Hz. It is automatically changed depending on the content displayed. The refresh rate is 1260 x 2730 pixels. The display supports 10-bit color, 2000 nits of peak brightness. The smartphone is...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Sony announces the Xperia Ace II for Japan with a 5.5" HD+ display, 4500 mAH battery
item.description: Sony has announced the Xperia Ace II for Japan positioning it as a very compact device with a big battery. It even says this is "the world's smallest smartphone equipped with a 4500 mAh battery". The smartphone is only 140 mm high, 69 mm wide, and 8.9 mm thick. It packs a 4500 mAh battery and a 5.5-inch HD+ display. Moreover, it is IP68 rated for water and dust resistance. Corning Gorilla Glass 6...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G 5G Mobile Platform is announced
item.description: Qualcomm has announced the Snapdragon 778G 5G Mobile Platform as the "ultimate multimedia triple threat featuring cutting-edge mobile gaming, accelerated AI, and premium capture experiences." The new mobile platform provides accelerated AI. Boasting a 2x performance improvement (up to 12 TOPS performance), the 6th Gen Qualcomm Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engine enriches every experience. The...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Samsung Galaxy F52 5G goes official in China with Snapdragon 750G
item.description: Samsung China has announced the Samsung Galaxy F52 5G. The device is built around a 6.6-inch IPS display with an FHD+ resolution and 120Hz refresh rate. A punch hole in the top right corner of the screen is the home of the 16MP front-facing camera with an f/2.0 aperture. The rear camera module comprises a 64MP primary shooter with an f/1.8 aperture, a 5MP ultra-wide unit, a 2MP depth-sensing, and...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Realme Narzo 30 is unveiled with a 6.5" FHD IPS display, Helio G95 chipset
item.description: Realme has announced for select markets the Realme Narzo 30. This smartphone is adorned with a 6.5-inch IPS display that offers 90Hz refresh rate and an FHD+ resolution - 1080 x 2400 pixels. The 16MP Sony IMX471 front camera resides in the punch hole placed in the top left corner of the display. On the back, there's a triple camera module with a LED flash. It comprises a 48MP main shooter with an...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: The Panasonic Toughbook S1 with a 7" HD display, Snapdragon 660 goes official
item.description: Panasonic announced the Toughbook S tablet. The device is based on a Snapdragon 660 chipset with a 2.2GHz octa-core CPU. It is built around a 7-inch HD display with a 10-point multi-touch panel and 500 nits of brightness. The tablet designed to meet the MIL-STD-810G standard with an all-weather IP65 and IP67 rating for dust and water resistance. The model has an optional 1D/2D barcode reader...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Google unveiled the first Beta of Android 12 at Google I/O
item.description: Google has unveiled the first Beta of Android 12 at Google I/O. The first major change is the most significant UI update to Andriod yet, created with a design language that the company calls Material You. It has been rethought from the colors to the shapes to achieve a more expressive, dynamic, and personal UI. These changes include redesigned widgets featuring new interactive controls, improved...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: MediaTek unveils the 6nm 5G Dimensity 900 chipset
item.description: The latest 5G chipset from MediaTek is the Dimensity 900. Built on TSMC's 6nm process, this system-on-chip houses an eight-core CPU with two 2.4GHz Cortex-A78 cores and six 2GHz Cortex-A55 cores. The Arm Mali-G68 GPU features all the technologies of the bigger G88, but with a design optimized for power efficiency. Their work is complemented by a 3rd Generation MediaTek APU. Dimensity 900 supports...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Redmi Note 10S announced for India
item.description: Xiaomi has announced the Redmi Note 10S for India. Based on a MediaTek Helio G95 chipset, it arrives in three RAM+storage flavors - 6GB+64GB which cost INR 15K and 6GB+128GB which costs INR 16K. The front is adorned with a 6.43-inch AMOLED display with an FHD+ resolution and a 180Hz touch sampling rate. A small punch hole is where the 13MP selfie camera resides. On the back, the 64MP main shooter...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: ZTE Axon 30 Ultra goes on sale in the USA, UK, Europe
item.description: Pre-orders for the ZTE Axon 30 Ultra will open on May 27 with sales commencing on June 4. The price starts at USD 749 (£649 / €749) for the 8GB+128GB and includes a free pair of Livebuds TWS earbuds when you pre-order the smartphone. The 12GB+256GB variant costs USD 849 (£739 / €849). The device is based on a Snapdragon 888 chipset aided by a triple ice-sealed VC liquid cooling system. A 4600 mAh...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: Pixelworks Display Technology powers the Asus Zenfone 8 and Asus Zenfone 8 Flip displays
item.description: The Asus Zenfone 8 is built on a beautiful 5.9" display with 120 HZ refresh rate and resolution of 1080 x 2448 pixels, while the Asus Zenfone 8 Flip offers the same resolution in a 6.67" OLED display with a 90 Hz refresh rate. Together, the Zenfone 8 series deliver superior display performance based on visual processing technologies by Pixelworks, including the following: Industry-leading HDR –...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: The Asus Zenfone 8 Flip is unveiled with a flip camera and enhanced motor module
item.description: Asus did not forget about its flip camera technology. It has fitted it in the Asus Zenfone 8 Flip and features an enhanced motor module with a 50% stronger output shaft and passed successfully 300,000 flips which equal 100 flips per day for more than 8 years. Of course, the smartphone is based on a Snapdragon 888 chipset with up to 8GB of LPDDR5 RAM and up to 256GB of UFS 3.1 storage. It also...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications

item.title: The Asus Zenfone 8 goes official with a super-compact body, 5.9" screen, Snapdragon 888, 4000 mAh battery
item.description: The Asus Zenfone 8 has been unveiled. The compact smartphone is only 68.5 mm wide and 148 mm tall. This compactness was purposefully achieved. The model has a frosted glass back that's 3D cursed for improved grip and less fingerprint residue. The body is available in Obsidian Black and Horizon Silver colors. It is also IP68 rated for water and dust resistance. Yet, the device does not compromise...
item.author: DeviceSpecifications
